DataElement.preferredName: Patient Histologic Or Cytopathology Confirmation Acute Myeloid Leukemia Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine clinical trial participation for questions related to histological or cytological confirmation of AML as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Histologic Or Cytopathology Confirmation Acute Myeloid Leukemia Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A branch of pathology that studies and diagnoses diseases on the cellular level including the anatomy, physiology, pathology and chemistry of the cell._Having been established or verified._A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification)._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Histologic Or Cytopathology Confirmation Acute Myeloid Leukemia Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A branch of pathology that studies and diagnoses diseases on the cellular level including the anatomy, physiology, pathology and chemistry of the cell.:Having been established or verified.:A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification).:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A branch of pathology that studies and diagnoses diseases on the cellular level including the anatomy, physiology, pathology and chemistry of the cell.

A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification).
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have histologica
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed acute myeloid leukemia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed Acute Myeloid Leukemia by World Health Organization (WHO) criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an established and confirmed diagnosis of AML by World Health Organization criteria, excluding acute promyelocytic leukemia (APL) (with promyelocytic leukemia -retinoic acid receptor alpha [PML-RARA])?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed acute myeloid leukemia (AML)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have pathological confirmation of AML as defined by histologic, morphologic, or cytological evidence/confirmation of greater than or equal to 20% blasts in bone marrow aspirate and/or biopsy?
